attributes.action: allow defendants to sit with their barrister in Crown Court during their trial so they can give instructions ‘on the fly’
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Defendants need to be allowed to sit with their barrister in Crown Court during their trial so they can give instructions ‘on the fly’. At present, defendants sit in the dock and cannot easily communicate with their legal team, for example when they spot a witness' lie that can easily be disproved by a ‘snap’ question.  Often the defendant may not be able to communicate with their Barrister until after the lying witness has left – at which point it is too late.  Wrongful convictions result.
